title: How to Change an Address of a Drivers License in Texas

steps.title: Visit the website.
steps.content: Visit the website. The direct link to change your address is https://txapps.texas.gov/tolapp/txdl/welcome.dl .

steps.title: Verify that you are eligible.
steps.content: Verify that you are eligible. To change your address online, you must meet certain eligibility requirements. [2] X Research source If you don’t meet these requirements, you will have to apply in person or by mail. To be eligible to change your address online, the following must be true: your license may not be currently expired or suspended you may not have any outstanding traffic tickets or warrants you must be at least 18 years old but younger than 79 years old you must be a lawful United States citizen or permanent resident your Social Security Number must already be on file with the Texas Department of Public Safety your license may not be a Class A, Class B, or a commercial driver's license you must have a printer available to print a temporary license until a new one arrives by mail.

steps.title: Follow the online prompts to change your address.
steps.content: Follow the online prompts to change your address. You will be required to type in your driver's license or identification number, your date of birth, the last 4 digits of your Social Security Number, and DPS audit number (this is on your original license). Click Continue to proceed.

steps.title: Complete the address change and review your details.
steps.content: Complete the address change and review your details. Before you finalize your address change online, you will have the option to sign up for voter registration and Selective Service if you are a male between the ages of 18 and 25. Review your address change details and click Continue to proceed. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Pay the fee required for address changes.
steps.content: Pay the fee required for address changes. Online address changes will cost a total of $11.00. The address change is $10, plus $1 for the Texas.gov administration fee. After you pay the fee, the address change process will be complete. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Print a temporary license.
steps.content: Print a temporary license. The online prompt will lead you to print a temporary license with the new address. You should carry this, along with your original license, whenever you are driving, until the new permanent license arrives in the mail. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Wait to receive your new license.
steps.content: Wait to receive your new license. A new permanent driver’s license, with the address change, should arrive within 45-60 days. If you do not receive it within this time, contact the Texas DPS Customer Service line (512-424-2600) to check on the status.

steps.title: Verify that you are eligible for the telephone service.
steps.content: Verify that you are eligible for the telephone service. To change your address by telephone, you must meet certain eligibility requirements. [6] X Research source If you don’t meet these requirements, you will have to apply in person or by mail. To be eligible to change your address by telephone, the following must be true: your license may not be currently expired or suspended you may not have any outstanding traffic tickets or warrants you must be at least 18 years old but younger than 79 years old you must be a lawful United States citizen or permanent resident your Social Security Number must already be on file with the Texas Department of Public Safety your license may not be a Class A, Class B, or a commercial driver's license.

steps.title: Call the Texas Department of Public Safety Driver License Renewal Line.
steps.content: Call the Texas Department of Public Safety Driver License Renewal Line. You can reach the Driver’s License Renewal service at 866-357-3639. [7] X Research source You will need to be using a touch-tone telephone for the service to work.

steps.title: Follow the automated telephone prompts.
steps.content: Follow the automated telephone prompts. You will be asked several questions about your status as a resident and driver, and you will be prompted to provide the new address.

steps.title: Pay the fee.
steps.content: Pay the fee. The fee for changing your address by telephone is $11.00. This constitutes a $10 cost for the license and a $1 service fee for using the telephone renewal. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Wait to receive your new license.
steps.content: Wait to receive your new license. A new permanent driver’s license, with the address change, should arrive within 45-60 days. If you do not receive it within this time, contact the Texas DPS Customer Service line (512-424-2600) to check on the status.

steps.title: Download the form.
steps.content: Download the form. You can download a change-of-address form to fill out and mail to the Texas Department of Public Safety Driver's License Division. Visit to download and print the form.

steps.title: Complete the form.
steps.content: Complete the form. Be sure to complete all required information on the form. Leaving out any necessary information may result in a delay or may just not become effective. Print neatly in all boxes so that your information will be recorded correctly.

steps.title: Include the fee.
steps.content: Include the fee. If you change your address by mail, the fee will only be $10.00. This fee must be paid by check or money order. Do not send cash in the mail.

steps.title: Send in the completed form and payment.
steps.content: Send in the completed form and payment. The completed form, along with payment, should be mailed to Texas Department of Public Safety, P.O. Box 149008, Austin, TX 78714-9008.

steps.title: Wait to receive your new license.
steps.content: Wait to receive your new license. A new permanent driver’s license, with the address change, should arrive within 45-60 days. If you do not receive it within this time, contact the Texas DPS Customer Service line (512-424-2600) to check on the status.

steps.title: Locate the nearest office.
steps.content: Locate the nearest office. You can find an office location nearest you by visiting https://www.dps.texas.gov/DriverLicense/appointments.htm . You will need to enter your zip code, and the site will tell you the nearest office.

steps.title: Make an appointment.
steps.content: Make an appointment. At several office locations (but not all), you are able to schedule an appointment online, in order to minimize your waiting time at the office. The locations that offer this service are: Austin – North Lamar Boerne Corpus Christi Dallas – South Mega Center Dallas Area – Garland Mega Center Fort Worth Mega Center Houston – Gessner Mega Center Houston – North Mega Center Houston Area – Rosenberg Mega Center Houston Area – Spring Mega Center Lake Worth Lubbock McAllen New Braunfels Plugerville Mega Center San Antonio Area – Leon Valley Mega Center

steps.title: Be sure to take the necessary identification documents.
steps.content: Be sure to take the necessary identification documents. You will need your original license, Social Security card, and the fee.

steps.title: Visit the DPS office nearest you.
steps.content: Visit the DPS office nearest you. You will meet with a service representative, who will check your identifying documentation and the information about your new address.

steps.title: Pay the fee.
steps.content: Pay the fee. The fee to update your address in person is $10.00. In person, you may pay by cash, check, credit card or money order.
